page.title: 17LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: In Harlow there are 42 councillors.A councillor represents everyone living in his ward.Councillors are elected for a four year term of office.In Harlow there are 16 wards:Brays Grove, Great Parndon,Hare Street and the town centre,Katherines,Sumners,Kingsmoor, Latton Bush,Little Parndon,Mark Hall North,Mark Hall South,Netteswell East, Netteswell West,Old Harlow,Passmores, Potter Street,Stewards,Tye Green. Harlow Council are responsible for enviromental health,refuse collection, planning control,parks,playing fields, open spaces,entertainment swimming pool and maintenance and control of rented housing for the whole of the town. Harlow Council acts as an agent for Essex County Council for highways maintenance,traffic management e.t.c. food and drug administration and museums.
